title: Caesar's Civil War: Battle of Pharsalus: Julius Caesar decisively defeats Pompey at Pharsalus and Pompey flees to Egypt.
text: Caesar's Civil War: Battle of Pharsalus: Julius Caesar decisively defeats Pompey at Pharsalus and Pompey flees to Egypt.

title: Gothic War: Battle of Adrianople: A large Roman army led by Emperor Valens is defeated by the Visigoths. Valens is killed along with over half of his army.
text: Gothic War: Battle of Adrianople: A large Roman army led by Emperor Valens is defeated by the Visigoths. Valens is killed along with over half of his army.

title: Construction of the campanile of the Cathedral of Pisa (now known as the Leaning Tower of Pisa) begins; it will take two centuries to complete.
text: Construction of the campanile of the Cathedral of Pisa (now known as the Leaning Tower of Pisa) begins; it will take two centuries to complete.

title: Quilon, the first Indian Christian Diocese, is erected by Pope John XXII; the French-born Jordanus is appointed the first Bishop.
text: Quilon, the first Indian Christian Diocese, is erected by Pope John XXII; the French-born Jordanus is appointed the first Bishop.

title: Ottoman–Venetian War (1499–1503): The Ottomans capture Methoni, Messenia.
text: Ottoman–Venetian War (1499–1503): The Ottomans capture Methoni, Messenia.

title: The First Anglo-Powhatan War begins in colonial Virginia.
text: The First Anglo-Powhatan War begins in colonial Virginia.

title: Napoleon annexes Westphalia as part of the First French Empire.
text: Napoleon annexes Westphalia as part of the First French Empire.

title: Indian Wars: The Creek sign the Treaty of Fort Jackson, giving up huge parts of Alabama and Georgia.
text: Indian Wars: The Creek sign the Treaty of Fort Jackson, giving up huge parts of Alabama and Georgia.

title: Louis Philippe becomes the king of the French following abdication of Charles X.
text: Louis Philippe becomes the king of the French following abdication of Charles X.

title: The Webster–Ashburton Treaty is signed, establishing the United States–Canada border east of the Rocky Mountains.
text: The Webster–Ashburton Treaty is signed, establishing the United States–Canada border east of the Rocky Mountains.

title: Henry David Thoreau publishes Walden.
text: Henry David Thoreau publishes Walden.

title: American Civil War: Battle of Cedar Mountain: At Cedar Mountain, Virginia, Confederate General Stonewall Jackson narrowly defeats Union forces under General John Pope.
text: American Civil War: Battle of Cedar Mountain: At Cedar Mountain, Virginia, Confederate General Stonewall Jackson narrowly defeats Union forces under General John Pope.

title: Indian Wars: Battle of the Big Hole: A small band of Nez Percé Indians clash with the United States Army
text: Indian Wars: Battle of the Big Hole: A small band of Nez Percé Indians clash with the United States Army

title: Thomas Edison receives a patent for a two-way telegraph.
text: Thomas Edison receives a patent for a two-way telegraph.

title: Glider pioneer Otto Lilienthal dies in a fatal crash.
text: Glider pioneer Otto Lilienthal dies in a fatal crash.

title: Edward VII and Alexandra of Denmark are crowned King and Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.
text: Edward VII and Alexandra of Denmark are crowned King and Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

title: The first Boy Scout encampment concludes at Brownsea Island in southern England.
text: The first Boy Scout encampment concludes at Brownsea Island in southern England.

title: Start of the Battle of Mulhouse, part of a French attempt to recover the province of Alsace and the first French offensive of World War I.
text: Start of the Battle of Mulhouse, part of a French attempt to recover the province of Alsace and the first French offensive of World War I.

title: A train robbery takes place in Kakori, near Lucknow, India
text: A train robbery takes place in Kakori, near Lucknow, India

title: Betty Boop makes her cartoon debut in Dizzy Dishes.
text: Betty Boop makes her cartoon debut in Dizzy Dishes.

title: Summer Olympic Games: Games of the XI Olympiad: Jesse Owens wins his fourth gold medal at the games.
text: Summer Olympic Games: Games of the XI Olympiad: Jesse Owens wins his fourth gold medal at the games.

title: World War II: Battle of Savo Island: Allied naval forces protecting their amphibious forces during the initial stages of the Battle of Guadalcanal are surprised and defeated by an Imperial Japanese Navy cruiser force.
text: World War II: Battle of Savo Island: Allied naval forces protecting their amphibious forces during the initial stages of the Battle of Guadalcanal are surprised and defeated by an Imperial Japanese Navy cruiser force.

title: The United States Forest Service and the Wartime Advertising Council release posters featuring Smokey Bear for the first time.
text: The United States Forest Service and the Wartime Advertising Council release posters featuring Smokey Bear for the first time.

title: Continuation War: The Vyborg–Petrozavodsk Offensive, the largest offensive launched by Soviet Union against Finland during the Second World War, ends to a strategic stalemate. Both Finnish and Soviet troops at the Finnish front dug to defensive positions, and the front remains stable until the end of the war.
text: Continuation War: The Vyborg–Petrozavodsk Offensive, the largest offensive launched by Soviet Union against Finland during the Second World War, ends to a strategic stalemate. Both Finnish and Soviet troops at the Finnish front dug to defensive positions, and the front remains stable until the end of the war.

title: World War II: Nagasaki is devastated when an atomic bomb, Fat Man, is dropped by the United States B-29 Bockscar. Thirty-five thousand people are killed outright, including 23,200-28,200 Japanese war workers, 2,000 Korean forced workers, and 150 Japanese soldiers.
text: World War II: Nagasaki is devastated when an atomic bomb, Fat Man, is dropped by the United States B-29 Bockscar. Thirty-five thousand people are killed outright, including 23,200-28,200 Japanese war workers, 2,000 Korean forced workers, and 150 Japanese soldiers.

title: The Red Army invades Japanese-occupied Manchuria.
text: The Red Army invades Japanese-occupied Manchuria.

title: South Kasai secedes from the Congo.
text: South Kasai secedes from the Congo.

title: Singapore is expelled from Malaysia and becomes the only country to date to gain independence unwillingly.
text: Singapore is expelled from Malaysia and becomes the only country to date to gain independence unwillingly.

title: Followers of Charles Manson murder pregnant actress Sharon Tate (wife of Roman Polanski), coffee heiress Abigail Folger, Polish actor Wojciech Frykowski, men's hairstylist Jay Sebring and recent high-school graduate Steven Parent.
text: Followers of Charles Manson murder pregnant actress Sharon Tate (wife of Roman Polanski), coffee heiress Abigail Folger, Polish actor Wojciech Frykowski, men's hairstylist Jay Sebring and recent high-school graduate Steven Parent.

title: The Troubles: The British Army in Northern Ireland launches Operation Demetrius. Hundreds of people are arrested and interned, thousands are displaced, and twenty are killed in the violence that followed.
text: The Troubles: The British Army in Northern Ireland launches Operation Demetrius. Hundreds of people are arrested and interned, thousands are displaced, and twenty are killed in the violence that followed.

title: Mars 7 is launched from the USSR.
text: Mars 7 is launched from the USSR.

title: As a direct result of the Watergate scandal, Richard Nixon becomes the first President of the United States to resign from office. His Vice President, Gerald Ford, becomes president.
text: As a direct result of the Watergate scandal, Richard Nixon becomes the first President of the United States to resign from office. His Vice President, Gerald Ford, becomes president.

title: The Italian prosecuting magistrate Antonino Scopelliti is murdered by the 'Ndrangheta on behalf of the Sicilian Mafia while preparing the government’s case in the final appeal of the Maxi Trial.
text: The Italian prosecuting magistrate Antonino Scopelliti is murdered by the 'Ndrangheta on behalf of the Sicilian Mafia while preparing the government’s case in the final appeal of the Maxi Trial.

title: The Liberal Democratic Party of Japan loses a 38-year hold on national leadership.
text: The Liberal Democratic Party of Japan loses a 38-year hold on national leadership.

title: Russian President Boris Yeltsin fires his Prime Minister, Sergei Stepashin, and for the fourth time fires his entire cabinet.
text: Russian President Boris Yeltsin fires his Prime Minister, Sergei Stepashin, and for the fourth time fires his entire cabinet.

title: At least 21 suspected terrorists were arrested in the 2006 transatlantic aircraft plot that happened in the United Kingdom. The arrests were made in London, Birmingham, and High Wycombe in an overnight operation.
text: At least 21 suspected terrorists were arrested in the 2006 transatlantic aircraft plot that happened in the United Kingdom. The arrests were made in London, Birmingham, and High Wycombe in an overnight operation.

title: Gunmen open fire at a Sunni mosque in the city of Quetta killing at least ten people and injuring 30.

title: Michael Brown, an 18-year-old African American male in Ferguson, Missouri, was shot and killed by a Ferguson police officer after reportedly assaulting the officer and attempting to steal his weapon, sparking protests and unrest in the city.
